channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 手紙ビベック・ラマスワミは、BuzzFeedへの出資比率を8.3%に引き上げた後、BuzzFeedがスタッフを解雇し、動画に注力し、タッカー・カールソンのような新しい声を採用するよう求めている（Alex Rogers/Financial Times）。
item.description:
Alex Rogers / Financial Times:
Letter: Vivek Ramaswamy calls for BuzzFeed to axe staff, focus on video, and hire new voices, like Tucker Carlson, after raising his stake in BuzzFeed to 8.3%  —  Former US Republican presidential candidate urges media group to hire from ‘across the political spectrum’

item.title: BBCニュースアプリのプッシュ通知は英国で大きな影響力を持つようになった。このアプリは推定1,200万インストールされ、ユーザーの〜60％が通知を受け取っている（Jim Waterson/The Guardian）
item.description:
Jim Waterson / The Guardian:
Push alerts from the BBC News app have become hugely influential in the UK; the app has an estimated 12M installs, with ~60% of its users getting notifications  —  With BBC news app alerts reaching as many as 7m Britons, parties are desperately trying to influence what gets pushed out

item.title: Antennaによると、2024年第1四半期に新規加入者の56％が安価な広告付き層を選んだという（John Koblin/New York Times）。
item.description:
John Koblin / New York Times:
A look at the growing importance of ads for video streaming services, as Antenna says that 56% of new subscribers chose the cheaper ad-supported tier in Q1 2024  —  Ads are here, there — almost everywhere — on streaming services now.  —  Not long ago, streaming TV came with a promise …

item.title: ある売れない俳優が、6億9,000万ドル以上のハリウッドねずみ講で友人や投資家をだまし、安く映画の権利を買い、大手映画会社に売ると主張した方法（Evan Osnos/New Yorker）
item.description:
Evan Osnos / New Yorker:
How a struggling actor duped friends and investors in a $690M+ Hollywood Ponzi scheme, claiming to buy cheap movie rights and sell them to major streamers  —  A struggling actor struck it rich in Hollywood—then the F.B.I. showed up.  —  Anyone who visited Zach and Mallory Horwitz in 2019 …

item.title: コムスコアメモリアルデーの週末興行収入は推定1億2830万ドルで、2020年と2021年を除くと29年ぶりの低水準、前年比～37％減。
item.description:
Pamela McClintock / The Hollywood Reporter:
Comscore: Memorial Day weekend box office grossed an estimated $128.3M, a 29-year low, excluding 2020 and 2021, and down ~37% YoY; Furiosa led with just $32M  —  Overall revenue for the four-day holiday also hits a 29-year low as the early summer calendar suffers from an unprecedented absence …

item.title: 2024年8月に同ツールを閉鎖するというメタ社の計画に対するEUの懸念に対処するため、メタ社はEU選挙期間中に使用するクラウドタングルに安全機能を追加した（Foo Yun Chee/Reuters）
item.description:
Foo Yun Chee / Reuters:
Meta adds safety features to CrowdTangle for use during the EU elections, in a bid to address EU concerns over Meta's plan to shut down the tool in August 2024  —  Meta Platforms (META.O) has added safety features to its misinformation tracking tool CrowdTangle for use during European Parliament elections …

item.title: BBCを相手取って法廷闘争を起こした4人の女性ジャーナリストの1人、マーティン・クロクサルが、1年以上の放送休止を経てスクリーンに復帰（Caroline Frost/Deadline）
item.description:
Caroline Frost / Deadline:
Martine Croxall, one of the four female BBC journalists who brought a tribunal claim against the BBC, returns to screen after being off-air for more than a year  —  BBC news presenter Martine Croxall has returned to screen after being off-air for more than a year, while her legal battle with her employer still plays out.

item.title: オーストラリアのテレビ局「ナイン」、元社長ダレン・ウィック氏への苦情を受け独立調査委員会を設置、ニュースルームの「文化的問題」を認める（Caitlin Cassidy/The Guardian）
item.description:
Caitlin Cassidy / The Guardian:
Australia's Nine commissions an independent review after complaints against former TV news boss Darren Wick and acknowledges “cultural issues” in its newsrooms  —  Chief executive Mike Sneesby acknowledges ‘very tough time’ for staff and ‘distress and frustration’ reports on allegations had caused

item.title: アリト判事の自宅前の国旗に関するワシントン・ポスト紙の選択は、ドブス以前のSCOTUS報道がいかに遜色ないものであったかを物語っている（Ben Smith/Semafor）
item.description:
Ben Smith / Semafor:
The Washington Post's choices with respect to covering the flag outside Justice Alito's house illustrate how deferential the coverage of SCOTUS was before Dobbs  —  The Scoop  —  In January 2021, the Washington Post's Supreme Court reporter and his editors agreed: The upside …

item.title: ソーシャルメディアからのトラフィックが減少する中、非営利の報道機関は、ジャーナリズムを新しい、そして十分なサービスを受けていないオーディエンスに配信するため、対面でのアウトリーチを試みている（Sarah Scire/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Sarah Scire / Nieman Lab:
As traffic from social media drops, nonprofit news outlets are experimenting with in-person outreach to distribute journalism to new and underserved audiences  —  As social platforms falter for news, a number of nonprofit outlets are rethinking distribution for impact and in-person engagement.

item.title: Netflixのテッド・サランドス氏とのQ&A：ハリウッドの現状、米国の嗜好の変化、番組戦略、広告、企業活動、YouTube、ライブイベント、AIなどについて（Lulu Garcia-Navarro/New York Times）
item.description:
Lulu Garcia-Navarro / New York Times:
Q&A with Netflix's Ted Sarandos on the state of Hollywood, shifting US tastes, programming strategy, ads, corporate activism, YouTube, live events, AI, and more  —  Devin Oktar Yalkin for The New York Times  —  If you're anything like me, you probably spent some large portion of this week sitting on your couch watching Netflix.

item.title: OpenAIは、左寄りのハフポストやブライトバート・ニュースのような右派のアウトレットなど、党派的なニュースサイトとのコンテンツライセンス契約には興味がないようだ（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
OpenAI seems to be uninterested in doing content licensing deals with partisan news sites, like left-leaning HuffPost or right-wing outlets like Breitbart News  —  The News  —  The partisan publishers that thrived during the social media age — most of all, high-flying right-wing outlets …

item.title: ポッドキャスト会社のレーベル、Radio Ambulante Recordsの立ち上げについて、Radio Ambulanteの共同設立者とQ&A。
item.description:
Hanaa' Tameez / Nieman Lab:
Q&A with Radio Ambulante's cofounders on the launch of Radio Ambulante Records, the podcast company's label, which they see as a community building exercise  —  “So much of podcast music is background, feels like filler sometimes, but with our composers, it never is.”

item.title: ワシントン州スポーケンのコミュニティ紙「ブラック・レンズ」を、スポークス・マン・レビュー紙が配布する印刷月刊紙として復活させる取り組みについて（Andrew Buncombe/The Guardian）
item.description:
Andrew Buncombe / The Guardian:
A look at efforts to revive the community newspaper The Black Lens in Spokane, WA, as a printed monthly distributed by the Spokesman-Review for now  —  The Spokane community revived the paper to capture the nuance of the Black community - beyond the ‘feel-good stories’

item.title: ペイロール・プロバイダーのCast & Crew社によると、カリフォルニア州は、労働者に直接支払うのではなく、出向会社を通じて支払うというハリウッドの一般的な慣習に異議を唱えている（Katie Kilkenny/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Katie Kilkenny / The Hollywood Reporter:
Payroll provider Cast & Crew says California is disputing the common Hollywood practice of paying workers through loan-out companies instead of directly  —  The California state department charged with disbursing unemployment benefits has disputed the practice of paying compensation …
